alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Walker (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 1:05AM CST until February 23 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Fayette and Walker. * WHEN...Until 700 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 105 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayette, Carbon Hill, Berry, Kansas, Nauvoo, Belk, Eldridge, Bankston, Fowlers Crossroads, Fayette County Public Lake, Richard Arthur Field, Bevill State College Fayette, Stone Wall, Cedrum Area and Lupton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
